attributes.description:
This visualization provides a quick summary of the total number of security-related reports generated within the selected time frame.

**Why this visualization works:**
It gives an immediate, high-level count of reporting activity.
This metric serves as a quick health check; a zero or unexpectedly low count is an immediate red flag that the reporting process may be broken, directly impacting compliance with CCI-003877.

**How an analyst can use it:**
Use this number as a starting point.
If the count seems low for the selected time range (e.g., you expect 30 daily reports in a month but see only 5), use the trend and table visualizations to pinpoint when the reporting stopped or became inconsistent.
This metric is a good barometer for the overall health of your security reporting function.

kibanaSavedObjectMeta.searchSourceJSON: {"query":{"language":"kuery","query":"event.action:(*report* OR *export* OR *download* OR *email*) AND (event.category:iam OR event.module:kibana) AND kibana.report.name:(*security* OR *compliance* OR *state* OR *vulnerability* OR *audit*)"},"filter":[],"indexRefName":"kibanaSavedObjectMeta.searchSourceJSON.index"}

attributes.title: [CA-7 / CCI-003877] Total Security Reports Generated
attributes.visState: {"title":"[CA-7 / CCI-003877] Total Security Reports Generated","type":"metric","aggs":[{"id":"1","enabled":true,"type":"count","params":{"customLabel":"Total Reports Generated","emptyAsNull":false},"schema":"metric"}],"params":{"addLegend":false,"addTooltip":true,"fontSize":"60","metric":{"colorSchema":"Green to Red","colorsRange":[{"from":0,"to":10000}],"invertColors":false,"labels":{"show":true},"metricColorMode":"None","percentageMode":false,"style":{"bgColor":false,"bgFill":"#000","fontSize":60,"labelColor":false,"subText":""},"useRanges":false},"type":"metric"}}

attributes.description: This section provides visualizations to help you assess compliance with CCI-003877, focusing on monitoring the status of security report generation. This visualization displays the health status of report generation based on anomaly scores from the associated ML job. To perform a component-level compliance assessment, utilize the global filters at the top of the Kibana dashboard. Apply filters like 'host.name: <your_component_name>' or 'kibana.report.name: <report_name>' to focus on specific systems or report types. Observe the trends and individual anomaly events. A high anomaly score indicates a significant deviation from the established baseline, which could signify unexpected failures, successes, or changes in the outcome of report generation, indicating potential issues with the report generation process itself or attempts to manipulate report integrity.
attributes.title: [CA-7, CCI-003877] Security Report Generation Status Monitoring ML
attributes.visState: {"title":"[CA-7, CCI-003877] Security Report Generation Status Monitoring ML","type":"metrics","aggs":[],"params":{"time_range_mode":"entire_time_range","axis_formatter":"number","axis_position":"left","axis_scale":"normal","background_color_rules":[{"value":0,"background_color":"rgba(14,242,71,1)","color":"rgba(0,0,0,1)","id":"anomaly-red","operator":"gte"},{"value":20,"background_color":"rgba(255,221,0,1)","color":"rgba(0,0,0,1)","id":"anomaly-yellow","operator":"gte"},{"value":100,"background_color":"rgba(249,3,3,1)","color":"rgba(0,0,0,1)","id":"anomaly-green","operator":"gte"}],"bar_color_rules":[],"drop_last_bucket":0,"filter":{"language":"kuery","query":"job_id:ca-7-cci-003877-security-report-generation-status-job"},"gauge_color_rules":[],"gauge_inner_width":10,"gauge_style":"half","gauge_width":10,"id":"ca-7-cci-003877-title","interval":"","isModelInvalid":false,"max_lines_legend":1,"series":[{"time_range_mode":"entire_time_range","axis_position":"right","chart_type":"line","color":"#68BC00","fill":0.5,"formatter":"0,0.[00]","hidden":false,"id":"metric-1","label":"CCI-003877 Health Status","line_width":1,"metrics":[{"field":"anomaly_score","id":"max-anomaly-score","type":"max"}],"override_index_pattern":0,"palette":{"name":"default","type":"palette"},"point_size":1,"separate_axis":0,"series_drop_last_bucket":0,"split_mode":"everything","stacked":"none"}],"show_grid":1,"show_legend":1,"time_field":"@timestamp","tooltip_mode":"show_all","truncate_legend":1,"type":"metric","use_kibana_indexes":true,"index_pattern_ref_name":"metrics_0_index_pattern"}}

attributes.description:
This visualization breaks down the generated reports by their names.

**Why this visualization works:**
It helps an analyst verify that the *correct* reports are being generated, not just that *some* report is running.
If your policy requires a 'Daily Vulnerability Summary' and a 'Weekly Compliance Overview', this chart will confirm if both are being created and in what proportion.
It helps ensure the substance of the reporting requirement is being met.

**How an analyst can use it:**
Review the pie chart slices to ensure all expected security reports are present.
If a critical report is missing from the chart, it means it hasn't been generated in the selected time frame.
Click on a slice to filter the entire dashboard for that specific report, allowing you to see its generation trend and detailed events.

kibanaSavedObjectMeta.searchSourceJSON: {"query":{"language":"kuery","query":"event.action:(*report* OR *export* OR *download* OR *email*) AND (event.category:iam OR event.module:kibana) AND kibana.report.name:(*security* OR *compliance* OR *state* OR *vulnerability* OR *audit*)"},"filter":[],"indexRefName":"kibanaSavedObjectMeta.searchSourceJSON.index"}

attributes.title: [CA-7 / CCI-003877] Top 5 Generated Security Reports

attributes.description:
This table provides a detailed, event-by-event breakdown of each generated security report.

**Why this visualization works:**
It offers granular proof of compliance.
When an auditor asks for evidence that a specific report was generated on a particular day, this table provides the definitive answer.
It shows the exact timestamp, the report name, and the user who generated it, which is crucial for forensic analysis and audit validation.

**How an analyst can use it:**
Use this table to investigate specific events.
Sort by '@timestamp' to see the most recent reports. Sort by 'user.name' to see who is responsible for generating the most reports.
If the trend chart shows a gap, you can use this table to confirm the exact last time a report was successfully generated before the failure.
This is your ground-truth log for all reporting activity.

kibanaSavedObjectMeta.searchSourceJSON: {"query":{"language":"kuery","query":"event.action:(*report* OR *export* OR *download* OR *email*) AND (event.category:iam OR event.module:kibana) AND kibana.report.name:(*security* OR *compliance* OR *state* OR *vulnerability* OR *audit*)"},"filter":[],"indexRefName":"kibanaSavedObjectMeta.searchSourceJSON.index"}
